data.title: 2025 Buyback Spree Is Top-Heavy as Fewer Firms Repurchase Shares
data.description: US companies are on track to hit a record $1.1 trillion in stock buybacks by the end of 2025, with the top 20 S&P 500 companies dominating 51.3% of total buyback activity, despite a decline in the number of companies announcing repurchases.

data.title: New England Research Dumps 5,293 Goldman Sachs Shares for $3.9 Million
data.description: New England Research and Management sold 5,293 shares of Goldman Sachs, reducing its stake to 0.5% of assets under management. The trade was valued at approximately $3.92 million, with the firm retaining 1,501 shares after the sale.

data.title: Q3 Earnings Season Preview: Little Suspense
data.description: The Q3 earnings season is expected to show solid corporate performance, driven by AI investments, resilient economic growth, and potential low-teens earnings growth for the S&P 500, with the Magnificent Seven tech companies leading the way.

data.title: Prediction: This AI Stock Could Be the First New $1 Trillion Company of the Decade
data.description: Oracle is approaching a $1 trillion market cap, driven by strong cloud infrastructure performance and AI potential, with 359% growth in remaining performance obligations. However, analysts suggest caution due to high valuation and debt levels.

data.title: Did Google Just Kill OpenAI and Become the Best AI Stock to Own Today?
data.description: Alphabet's Gemini AI app has rapidly gained popularity, becoming the top free app on the Apple App Store and challenging OpenAI's ChatGPT. The company's strong performance in AI, search, cloud, and consistent revenue growth have boosted investor confidence.
